10.1007/978-3-030-60975-7_16.title: Moral Framing and Ideological Bias of News
10.1007/978-3-030-60975-7_16.author: Mokhberian, Negar and Abeliuk, Andr\'{e}s and Cummings, Patrick and Lerman, Kristina
10.1007/978-3-030-60975-7_16.paperMotivationText: News outlets with different political slants, when talking about the same news story, usually emphasize various aspects and choose their language framing differently. This framing implicitly shows their biases and also affects the reader’s opinion and understanding. Therefore, understanding the framing in the news stories is fundamental for realizing what kind of view the writer is conveying with each news story.
10.1007/978-3-030-60975-7_16.paperContributionText: Development of methods for characterizing moral frames in the news: an unsupervised method that extracts the framing bias and the framing Intensity without any external framing annotations provided
10.1007/978-3-030-60975-7_16.paperResultsText: The findings reveal systematic differences across liberal and conservative media. The results support the correlations between political ideology and the five moral foundations.
